page.title: 01RESUME & GAZETTEER
page.content: The district is part of the Ria Estuary of the Fal and from the hilly ground on the West many small streams drain through deeply cut valleys to Coombe,Cowlands & Lamouth Creeks in the East,& Penpol in the South. From the detached bungalows & houses in Playing Place people commute to Truro, which is the market town.About 500 live here, with another 500 scattered nearby. More than half have 2 cars because of the scarcity of public transport. The 19th. century estates have been broken up and the houses used for other purposes; holiday flats, school and N.T. headquarters. The owners are still held in high esteem for historical rather than practical reasons. This is a pleasant area untouched by any kind of industrial development.
